description:
We said goodbye to our home.
The home where we brought our babes to live with us.
The home where our girls took their first steps.
The home where our son healed & overcame his many fears.
The home where weâ€™ve loved on & discipled TONS of teenagers & college students, even had sleepovers with 17 middle school girls!!
The home where we celebrated our kidsâ€™ adoptions.
.
We hugged our closest SJ family goodbye.
Although we wish we could have HUGGED everyone we love here goodbyeðŸ˜­...
We sold/donated & packed up everything.
Loaded into our mini van.
Then, we hit the road.
After two years of fostering our babes, we are celebrating the fact that they we now OURS. Which means we didnâ€™t have to explain or share all the details of our choices to anyone. We didnâ€™t have to ask our social worker and/or court judge for permission to leave. We could just, go.
So we are going.
Right now, we are headed to Indianapolis.
Living in the Bay was a wildly beautiful & growing experience. We are trusting that this next adventure will be no different.
Cheers to moving across the country for the THIRD time. FIRST TIME WITH KIDSðŸ˜³
...should I share all the craziness of our 6 day road trip in my stories?((why isnâ€™t there a girl pulling her hair out emoji?!?))
.
.
.
.
